'''Neil McLean''' is an American saxophonist now residing in Tyler, Texas.  As a member of the Henry Kimbrell Group, [[Ray Reach and Friends]], the [http://www.bhamwiki.com/wiki/index.php?title=SuperJazz_Big_Band SuperJazz Big Band] and the [[Magic City Jazz Orchestra]], he worked with numerous notable performers, including [[Dionne Warwick]], [[Ella Fitzgerald]], [[Ernie Watts]], [[Lou Marini]], [[Ellis Marsalis, Jr.|Ellis Marsalis]] and many others.  For many years, while residing in Birmingham, Alabama, Neil established himself as one of the premier saxophonists in the Southeast.  His arrangements for the [[SuperJazz Big Band]] are among the finest performed by that venerable ensemble.

McLean was inducted into the [[Alabama Jazz Hall of Fame]] in 1983.

==Selected discography==
* [http://www.bhamwiki.com/wiki/index.php?title=Ray_Reach_and_Friends Ray Reach and Friends].  ''"Especially For You"'' (1994).  Jazz quartet.  Available at CDBaby.com.
* [[Ellis Marsalis, Jr.|Ellis Marsalis]] and the [http://www.bhamwiki.com/wiki/index.php?title=SuperJazz_Big_Band SuperJazz Big Band].  ''"UAB SuperJazz, featuring Ellis Marsalis"'' (2001)  (Co-produced by [[Ray Reach]] and [[Henry Panion]]), recorded at the [[Alys Stephens Center]].
* [[Lou Marini]] and the [[Magic City Jazz Orchestra]]. ''"Lou's Blues"'' (2003) (Co-produced by [[Lou Marini]] and [[Ray Reach]])
